content.thinking: Looking at this document, I need to extract all text and then classify it properly. From the document, I can see: Front side (top): - REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA - IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL - CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA - NUMERO: 1.018.460.087 - OVALLE BAYER - APELLIDOS - DIEGO FERNANDO - NOMBRES - Diego F. Ovalle B. (signature) - FIRMA Back side (bottom): - FECHA DE NACIMIENTO: 16-JUN-1993 - MANI - (CASANARE) - LUGAR DE NACIMIENTO - 1.73 O+ M - ESTATURA G.S. RH SEXO - 20-JUN-2011 BOGOTA D.C - FECHA Y LUGAR DE EXPEDICION - REGISTRADOR NACIONAL - CARLOS ABRIL SANCHEZ TORRES - There's a fingerprint image - A barcode - INDICE DERECHO - P-1500150-003136B1-M-1018460087-20110713 Now for classification: This is clearly a Cédula de Ciudadanía (Colombian national ID card) which is a personal identification document issued by the government of Colombia. Key indicators for CECRL: - "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL" - "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" - Individual identification number with personal name - Personal biographical data: birth date (16-JUN-1993), birth place (MANI, CASANARE), blood type (O+), gender (M), height (1.73) - Individual photo (visible) - Signature reference (FIRMA) - Fingerprint (INDICE DERECHO) - Government-issued personal ID number - Security elements: official seals, barcode I confirm this is an official government-issued identification document with comprehensive personal details. The document contains multiple authentication elements like a signature, fingerprint, and official registration number, definitively proving its status as a national identification card. The document unequivocally belongs to the CECRL category, with no potential for misclassification given its clear governmental origin and personal identification purpose.
